intro: Psychotria monticola, commonly known as the mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in high-altitude cloud forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria monticola is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
